frontmatter.title: Deal with effect in Pure Functional ways

mainmatter.p: Lean distinguishes between evaluation of expressions, which strictly adheres to the mathematical model of substitution of values for variables and reduction of sub-expressions without side effects, and execution of IO actions, which rely on an external system to interact with the world.
Question: Can I say the thing can be calculate uses evaluation, and the thing can't uses execution?

frontmatter.title: An analogy: cook and counter worker

mainmatter.p: That makes me think about C-lang. There is also a main function, where we can put all the IO action if we'd like to. That is "to write C in functional way" (just joking) .
When talking about The world analogy, we can say Lean is a world-orented language.
Install toolchain and set to default: elan default [toolchain].
Create new lean project: lake new [projectname].
In lean, project name supposed to be like "xx-yy". For example, lean-demo is a good name.
Execute project: lake exec [targetname]. This target name can be check in lakefile.lean.
